title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki

vmassol - (09:50): silviar: good morning  
vmassol - (09:50): hope you had a good week end! :)  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 09:50  
silviar - (09:53): good morning vincent :)  
silviar - (09:53): i did, thanks  
vmassol - (09:53): silviar: I think the best would be for you to send a mail to the devs mailing list for feedback on your user guide  
vmassol - (09:53): (so that we can then move it to its target location)  
vmassol - (09:54): (after the feedback)  
vmassol - (09:54): wdyt?  
silviar - (09:54): yes, i was going to send an email this morning  
vmassol - (09:54): ok cool  
silviar - (09:54): talked about it with Guillaume on friday  
vmassol - (09:56): CalebJamesDeLisl: hi  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:56): hello.  
vmassol - (09:57): if your patch re memory issue in tests works fine and if it speeds up test execution (it should) you could propose it on the devs list I think and then apply it  
vmassol - (09:57): wdyt?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:57): I have been using it locally, I'll do that.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:57): I'd like to change xwiki-core/pom.xml so instead of including files for checkstyle, it excludes them. Sound good?  
vmassol - (09:58): hmm  
vmassol - (09:58): you'll have a LOT of work  
vmassol - (09:58): for xwiki-core  
vmassol - (09:58): since almost none pass the checkstyle tests  
vmassol - (09:58): but yes  
vmassol - (09:58): I also prefer exlusion  
vmassol - (09:58): to incitate new code to pass checkstyle tests  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:58): I removed the includes, ran mvn clean install, and ran regular expressions on the result. I have the patch ready :)  
vmassol - (09:58): cool  
vmassol - (09:58): go for it!  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:59): No issue number right?  
vmassol - (09:59): right  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:59): Ok.  
vmassol - (09:59): question:  
vmassol - (09:59): if I add a new file  
vmassol - (09:59): will it be picked up by your excludes  
vmassol - (10:00): or will checkstyle execute on it?.  
vmassol - (10:00): ideally checkstyle should execute on it  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:01): I think it will, there are no includes, only excludes. You're the maven guy, you tell me :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:03): done. sed is a beautiful thing.  
joschi\_qweb joined #xwiki at 10:04  
vmassol - (10:08): CalebJamesDeLisl: ok seen the commit, thought you had used wildcards… since you haven't yes new files will be picked up  
vmassol - (10:08): personally I'm +1 to do what you've done for all modules  
vmassol - (10:08): tmortagne: wdyt?  
vmassol - (10:08): CalebJamesDeLisl: since you're at it  
vmassol - (10:08): I see that http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MCHECKSTYLE-54 is fixed  
tmortagne - (10:08): vmassol: i.e. not use wildcards ?  
vmassol - (10:08): and at the bottom of your commit I see:  
vmassol - (10:09):  <!-- these files are clean, but failed in checkstyle because http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MCHECKSTYLE-54 : -->  
vmassol - (10:09): maybe this can be removed now?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:09): I'll give it a shot.  
vmassol - (10:09): tmortagne: yes about using excludes to force new files to run checkztyle  
vmassol - (10:09): ie the norm is to run checkstyle  
tmortagne - (10:09): +1 for excludes yes  
vmassol - (10:09): and the exception is to exclude files  
tmortagne - (10:09): make more sense that what we have now for usre  
tmortagne - (10:09): \*sure  
vmassol - (10:10): CalebJamesDeLisl: yes I love sed too ;)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:10): This is what I did:  sed -e '/:[0-9]\*: warning: /d' -e 's/^\/media\/\_extended\/java\/xwikiSrc\/platform\/trunks\/core\/xwiki-core\/src\/main\/java\/com\/xpn\/xwiki\([^:]\*java\):.\*$/\\*\\*\1,/' -e '$!N; /^\(.\*\)\n\1$/!P; D'  
bblfish - (10:11): hello  
bblfish - (10:11): bonjour  
vmassol - (10:11): hi bblfish  
bblfish - (10:11): we just discovered something fun on the foaf protocols mailing list  
vmassol - (10:11): reminds me we need to upgrade myxwiki to 2.3snap  
vmassol - (10:11): any volunteer for the myxwiki.org upgrade? :)  
bblfish - (10:13): RT: @vmassol ny volunteer for the myxwiki.org upgrade? :)  
vmassol - (10:14): hehe  
bblfish - (10:15): the fun thing we discovered was that we can use your webid/openid to do HTTP digest authentication http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Http\_digest\_authentication  
shelan\_ joined #xwiki at 10:15  
bblfish - (10:16): so that you could go to any site that supports this, type your openid into an HTTP\_DIGEST form, and the server receiving the password would GET your openid/webid find a link to a script to which it can then send the encrypted password and nonce for verification  
bblfish - (10:16): so you can login to sites with HTTP digest without them having your password :-)  
bblfish - (10:17): (not as neat as foaf+ssl, as the user has to type a username and a password, but it could be useful)  
bblfish - (10:18): [ another good reason to have cool personal home page uris ]  
bblfish - (10:19): ( we still need to test this...)  
bblfish - (10:22): perhaps not a good idea for any password that is not a one time password though  
Enygma`1 joined #xwiki at 10:22  
vmassol - (10:23): looks fun!

CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:29): re: do we have a memory leak: IMO if we have to run tests in isolation then there is a memory leak, it just doesn't ever get a chance to exhaust the heap. I can change it if you want though.  
vmassol - (10:30): CalebJamesDeLisl: yep realized after I posted my first comment… sorry for the noise  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:32): No pb, I just removed a trailing comma I had left in pom.xml, everyone does it.

CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:37): That is quite an awesome fix, I would never have thought of extending something third party if it didn't work "right".  
vmassol - (10:37): well it was only the client side that didn't have that api I believe  
vmassol - (10:37): luckily the server had the feature in  
vmassol - (10:37): (apparently)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:42): Hmm.  
vmassol - (10:47): jvelociter: good morning. BTW I have added 2 comments for you to remove once you have fixed the redirect issue for import: "            // TODO: Remove this when the delete doesn't redirect to the Admin home page any more (which is a bug)  
vmassol - (10:47): "  
vmassol - (10:47): (in case you hadn't seen them)  
vmassol - (10:47): :)

vmassol - (10:54): CalebJamesDeLisl: 53 checkstyle errors :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:54): Oops!  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:55): I didn't see any, I'll rebuild.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:59): Ahh, it appears those 'clean' files weren't as clean as they said.  
vmassol - (10:59): and you believed the doc? :)  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 11:00  
vmassol - (11:00): tmortagne: fyi I got some NPEs from the lucene plugin: http://tinypaste.com/399fb  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:00): I ran the test after I removed them, I'm not sure why it seemed to succeed.  
tmortagne - (11:01): vmassol: " com.xpn.xwiki.plugin.lucene.AttachmentData.getContentAsText(AttachmentData.java:162) " again some null attachment it seems, i can't do much at Lucene plugin a nicer log indication null attachment instead of a nullpointer  
tmortagne - (11:02): \*except a nicer log  
vmassol - (11:02): well maybe you shouldn't try to index some null attachments in the plugin?  
tmortagne - (11:02): vmassol: it's not supposed to be null  
vmassol - (11:02): (we should find why we have null attachments of course)  
vmassol - (11:03): yes nicer log as warning would be better probbaly  
vmassol - (11:03): (I'm hesitating between error or warning for the severity, probably warning though since the app can still continue to work)  
tmortagne - (11:03): well error make more sense since a null attachment is very wrong  
tmortagne - (11:04): but since it's not a problem at Lucene level yes not sure  
vmassol - (11:04): ok  
vmassol - (11:04): in any case the important part is fixing the null  
tmortagne - (11:04): ho did you reproduce it ? upload in import UI again ?  
vmassol - (11:04): yes  
vmassol - (11:05): by running the automated import test  
tmortagne - (11:05): look like it's always related to importer  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 11:18  
jvelociter - (11:31): vmassol: yes, seen that yesterday  
jvelociter - (11:31): thanks  
vmassol - (11:31): jvelociter: I'm working on setting up a test suite now  
jvelociter - (11:32): cool  
vmassol1 joined #xwiki at 11:40  
vmassol left at 11:43 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
vmassol1 - (11:50): tmortagne: wdym by "blank result"?  
vmassol1 - (11:50): ah spaces  
tmortagne - (11:51): vmassol1: i mean StringUtils.isBlank()  
vmassol1 - (12:06): jvelociter: fyi if you need to create some temp folder in a junit test, the canonical way for doing it is to use @Rule with a TemporaryFolder rule, see http://github.com/KentBeck/junit/blob/master/src/main/java/org/junit/rules/TemporaryFolder.java  
vmassol1 - (12:06): some more info here: http://blog.mycila.com/2009/11/writing-your-own-junit-extensions-using.html  
jvdrean left at 12:07 (Quit: Leaving.  
jvelociter - (12:08): vmassol1: yes I've seen that the other day, but I think in the version used by Selenium2 it's not there already  
vmassol1 - (12:08): it's not related to selenium  
vmassol1 - (12:08): it's junit4  
jvelociter - (12:08): (the @Rule annotation)  
jvelociter - (12:08): yes but webdriver depends on junit  
vmassol1 - (12:08): ?  
jvelociter - (12:08): on a certain version of junit  
jvelociter - (12:08): no ?  
vmassol1 - (12:08): I don't see why it woul  
vmassol1 - (12:08): d  
vmassol1 - (12:08): we're using junit4 anyway  
vmassol1 - (12:09): :)  
jvelociter - (12:09): it's only since junit 4.7  
jvelociter - (12:09): the annotation  
vmassol1 - (12:09): ok but still I don't see why selenium4 would jave anything specific to junit  
vmassol1 - (12:10): selenium2  
vmassol1 - (12:10): ;)  
vmassol1 - (12:10): s/jave/have/  
jvelociter - (12:10): ok, maybe it does not  
jvelociter - (12:10): but in the effective pom of the module, it's not junit 4.7  
jvelociter - (12:10): it's 4.6 or 4.5 AFAIR  
vmassol1 - (12:10): our module you mean?  
jvelociter - (12:10): (I know, I tried using it)  
jvelociter - (12:10): yes  
vmassol1 - (12:10): if it's ours we need to upgrade to the latest junit  
vmassol1 - (12:10): it's easy enough to do  
jvelociter - (12:10): xwiki-enterprise-tests-ui  
jvelociter - (12:11): but I don't need a temp folder in the end  
vmassol1 - (12:11): I know  
vmassol1 - (12:11): just watned to let you know since I didn't know you knew about it  
vmassol1 - (12:11): :)  
jvelociter - (12:11): ok  
vmassol1 - (12:14): ExpectedException sounds cool  
vmassol1 - (12:14): http://github.com/KentBeck/junit/blob/master/src/main/java/org/junit/rules/ExpectedException.java  
vmassol1 - (12:14): the cool thing is that we can expect the message  
tmortagne - (12:15): yes that's cool (used that a long time ago with nunit)  
joschi\_qweb - (12:15): hi everybody!  
joschi\_qweb - (12:15): is there a painless way to migrate from MediaWiki to XWiki?  
vmassol1 - (12:15): because @Test(expected = NumberFormatException.class) is too limited  
jvelociter - (12:16): nice  
joschi\_qweb - (12:16): the script from http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extensions/MediaWiki2XWikiExtension only migrates the latest version of a page and does not migrate files.  
joschi\_qweb - (12:16): is there anything better out there?  
vmassol1 - (12:17): joschi\_qweb: a pity asiri isn't logged here since he would know better  
vmassol1 - (12:17): but yes an importer has been developed during the past google summer of code  
vmassol1 - (12:17): I just don't know it's exact status  
vmassol1 - (12:17): s/it's/its/  
vmassol1 - (12:17): let me try to find where it's located  
vmassol1 - (12:17): http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/contrib/sandbox/importexport/  
joschi\_qweb - (12:18): ah, thanks  
vmassol1 - (12:18): it's probably pretty rough though, would be good to get asiri's input  
joschi\_qweb - (12:18): I only found http://gsoc.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Import%20Export%20other%20wikis/MediaWiki%20Features so far  
vmassol1 - (12:18): you can send a mail on the xwiki users lists to ask  
vmassol1 - (12:18): both asiri and wang ning (daning) should be able to answer your questions  
tmortagne - (12:19): vmassol1: you mean arun  
tmortagne - (12:19): ?  
vmassol1 - (12:19): yes arun sorry  
joschi\_qweb - (12:20): ok, thanks you vmassol1 and tmortagne. I think I'll try the converter and ask on the mailing list if I can't get it running  
vmassol1 - (12:20): some info here too: http://gsoc.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Import%20Export%20other%20wikis/WebHome  
vmassol1 - (12:20): I remember there was a nicer page explaining how to run it but I cannot find it again  
joschi\_qweb - (12:21): yes, found that already but some how didn't see a link to the svn repo  
tmortagne - (12:26): i'm searching another name for XWiki#parseTemplate(String template, XWikiContext context) to have a version with throws and deprecate the old one, any idea for the new name ?  
vmassol1 - (12:26): evaluateTemplate, renderTemplate, executeTemplate,  
vmassol1 - (12:27): parse is not correct  
vmassol1 - (12:27): actually  
vmassol1 - (12:27): since it's not about parsing but about execution  
tmortagne - (12:27): well thing is there is a lot of parseTemplate methods that are usiong this one or with differents parameters, will be weird to have a name completely different  
tmortagne - (12:28): (but yes i know parse is not correct should be evaluate)  
tmortagne - (12:29): will use evaluateTemplate for my test and change it if something comes  
tmortagne - (12:29): thanks  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 12:37  
vmassol1 - (12:39): tmortagne: now this list is not updated automaitcally: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/I18N :)  
vmassol1 - (12:39): (which is ok IMO)  
vmassol1 - (12:40): should I add catalan now?  
tmortagne - (12:40): ha yes indeed, did not even know this list :)  
vmassol1 - (12:40): actually we could add @since after languages  
tmortagne - (12:40): why don't you want to automatically update it ?  
vmassol1 - (12:41): for 2 reasons  
vmassol1 - (12:41): (but I'm ok to do it)  
vmassol1 - (12:41): reason 1: it creates a point of failure  
vmassol1 - (12:41): (when l10n is not working)  
vmassol1 - (12:41): reason 2: speed. But this can be fixed with caching  
vmassol1 - (12:41): so if you can cache I'm ok to do it  
vmassol1 - (12:42): xwiki.org is hit quite a lot  
tmortagne - (12:42): indeed, well we don't add new language that often so we can update the list by hand  
vmassol1 - (12:42): reason 3: the status is not the same with released version and l10n  
vmassol1 - (12:42): for ex a new language can be added on l10n but still not be there in the latest released version of XE  
vmassol1 - (12:43): I like the idea of adding a @since too  
vmassol1 - (12:43): is catalan present in 2.2? 2.2.1? 2.3M1?  
tmortagne - (12:43): (btw yes ca can be added because i released it with 2.2.1)  
tmortagne - (12:43): hcekcing to be sure  
vmassol1 - (12:43): actually there are 23 languages on l10n  
tmortagne - (12:43): yes that's it 2.2.1  
vmassol1 - (12:43): ok adding  
vmassol1 - (12:44): so there's another one too  
tmortagne - (12:44): zh\_TW  
tmortagne - (12:44): going for lunch  
jvdrean left at 13:01 (Ping timeout: 256 seconds

bblfish - (13:06): Thanks guys for suggesting I download it when I was in Paris

vmassol - (16:05): tmortagne: lucene search broken again on xwiki.org, fixing it  
tmortagne - (16:05): vmassol: ok  
vmassol - (16:05): guysn we need to upgrade xwiki.org to 2.2.1 I think and myxwiki.org to 2.3 snap  
joschi\_qweb left at 16:05 (Quit: Page closed  
vmassol - (16:05): jvdrean: would you have some time to help on this? :)  
bbc581 left at 16:12 (Remote host closed the connection  
vmassol - (16:21): sdumitriu: problem with blog post panel: https://www.codeaurora.org/xwiki/bin/Blog/Will+This+Be+Interesting%3F ?  
sdumitriu - (16:21): K  
vmassol - (16:21): (it was a question)  
vmassol - (16:22): this is a 2.0 XE so maybe it was fixed  
sdumitriu - (16:22): That's 2.0, I think it might have been fixed  
sdumitriu - (16:23): Still happening in 2.2.1  
sdumitriu - (16:24): Hm...  
sdumitriu - (16:24): I don't know how to fix it without changing it to HTML code  
sdumitriu - (16:24): [[page?]]  
sdumitriu - (16:24): ? is part of the document name  
sdumitriu - (16:24): But we allow query strings in there  
vmassol - (16:24): you need to escape it I think  
vmassol - (16:24): can you try?  
sdumitriu - (16:24): With ~?  
vmassol - (16:25): yes  
sdumitriu - (16:25): K, I'll try  
vmassol - (16:25): I don't know if it'll work actually  
sdumitriu - (16:25): What else would need escaping?  
vmassol - (16:25): let me find the code again  
tmortagne - (16:26): not sure we support escaping for ? actually  
vmassol - (16:26): tmortagne: yes that's what I wanted to check, probably not  
tmortagne - (16:26): and in any case it would need double escaping  
tmortagne - (16:26): [[page~~?]]  
sdumitriu - (16:26): Panels/MyRecentModifications uses HTML  
sdumitriu - (16:27): None works  
vmassol - (16:27): no we don't support escaping it  
vmassol - (16:27): there are 3 characters that would need this:  
vmassol - (16:28): ?, @ and #  
tmortagne - (16:28): yes just tested and i doubt we support escaping, at least i did not done it myself for sure  
vmassol - (16:28): the code is in AbstractLinkParser  
tmortagne - (16:29): @ ?  
tmortagne - (16:29): interwiki ?  
vmassol - (16:29): is that a question?  
vmassol - (16:29): yes  
vmassol - (16:29): @ is for interwiki links  
tmortagne - (16:29): ok  
vmassol - (16:29): (which isn't implemented in 2.0 syntax right now)  
sdumitriu - (16:30): So?  
sdumitriu - (16:30): What do we do?  
tmortagne - (16:30): so indeed that's a big limitation and we should implement escaping  
vmassol - (16:30): 1) jira issue for escaping link content for ?, @ and #  
vmassol - (16:30): 2) use html for now to fix the pb in the blog  
vmassol - (16:30): wdyt?  
jvdrean - (16:31): vmassol: yes I can upgrade xwiki.org and myxwiki.org  
vmassol - (16:31): jvdrean: wooho cool :)  
sdumitriu - (16:31): I don't like 2, but yes, that's the nly thing that can be done for now  
tmortagne - (16:31): vmassol: sounds good for now, we don't have much choice  
vmassol - (16:31): creating jira  
sdumitriu - (16:33): tmortagne: What's your strategy on XWIKI-4955 ?  
sdumitriu - (16:34): I wanted to implement a "Resource" (?) object, which would pinpoint a resource in its exact place: skin property, attachment, file, template...  
vmassol - (16:34): tmortagne: hmm shouldn't we use a different syntax instead of query string, anchors and interwiki links?  
tmortagne - (16:34): sdumitriu: i was about to committ, my strategy is pretty much what i said in the issue: adding a new method that throws exceptions instead of always returning "" and use it in Utils.parseTemplate  
sdumitriu - (16:34): And if a Resource object is found (not null) then leave the empty result  
vmassol - (16:34): as in [[reference||queryString="…" interwiki="…" anchor="…"]]
